N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 2002.3 - Municipal application

State Regulations
(a) Upon
the request of an eligible municipality, the corporation may conduct
orientation meetings with appropriate representatives of a municipality to
explain the corporation's services as related to a specific project(s) under
consideration by the municipality. (b) Following the orientation meeting and any
other communications as may be required to refine a project scope, the
municipality may issue a letter requesting the corporation's services. Upon
receipt of such letter, the corporation shall prepare and submit to the
municipality, in writing, an estimated project budget including the estimated
cost of the corporation's services, based on the requested scope of services
from the municipality. (c) If the
municipality, by resolution of its governing body, elects to utilize the
corporation's services, it shall notify the corporation in writing of such
determination and transmit a copy of such resolution by its governing body
authorizing the chief executive officer of the municipality to enter into an
agreement with the corporation for the project, and authorizing the expenditure
of sufficient municipal funds for the project including the estimated charges
for the corporation's services. Notes
